summary: The "Southern Border Farmers and Ranchers Protection Act" (H.R. 389) amends the Food Security Act of 1985 to establish a "Southern Border Initiative". This initiative authorizes the Secretary of Agriculture to provide financial assistance to farmers and ranchers in 35 specified Texas counties near the southern border. The payments, distributed through the Environmental Quality Incentives Program, are designated for implementing conservation practices to repair damage to agricultural land and farming infrastructure. Contracts for this government aid would have a one-year term.
